title.value: Towards Better Evaluation for Dynamic Link Prediction
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the paper and reflects the main focus of the research, which is improving the evaluation of dynamic link prediction methods.
title.quote: Towards Better Evaluation for Dynamic Link Prediction

extractions.description: The paper focuses on improving the evaluation procedures for link prediction in dynamic graphs. It proposes new evaluation metrics, negative sampling strategies, and introduces a memorization-based baseline called EdgeBank. Additionally, the paper contributes six new dynamic graph datasets from diverse domains to facilitate better comparison of dynamic link prediction methods.

type.justification: The paper introduces new datasets, evaluation strategies, and conducts experiments to assess different dynamic link prediction models, which indicates an empirical approach.
type.quote: In this section, we present a comprehensive evaluation of the dynamic link prediction task on all 13 datasets with 5 SOTA methods.

name.justification: The paper discusses improving evaluation strategies for dynamic link prediction, which is a key task typically handled by Graph Neural Networks (GNNs).
name.quote: Recently there is a surge of interest towards temporal networks. Kazemi et al. [16] present a survey of advances in representation learning on dynamic graphs.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on dynamic link prediction, as it proposes evaluation strategies specifically for this task.
name.quote: Link prediction is a fundamental learning task on dynamic graphs which focuses on predicting future connections between nodes.

name.justification: The paper evaluates dynamic link prediction methods which are a subcategory of dynamic graph representation learning.
name.quote: Dynamic Graph Representation Learning. Recently there is a surge of interest towards temporal networks.

name.justification: JODIE is mentioned as one of the recent models evaluated for dynamic link prediction in the paper.
name.quote: In our experiments we center our attention on five recent models of this type: JODIE [18], DyRep [38], TGAT [42], TGN [28], and CAWN [41].

is_contributed.justification: The paper does not claim to contribute JODIE; it is used for evaluation purposes.
is_contributed.quote: In our experiments we center our attention on five recent models of this type: JODIE [18], DyRep [38], TGAT [42], TGN [28], and CAWN [41].

is_executed.justification: JODIE is included in the experiments conducted in the paper, implying it was executed.
is_executed.quote: In our experiments we center our attention on five recent models of this type: JODIE [18], DyRep [38], TGAT [42], TGN [28], and CAWN [41].

name.justification: EdgeBank is one of the core contributions of the paper, proposed as a strong baseline.
name.quote: Based on this observation, we propose a pure memorization-based baseline called EdgeBank.

is_contributed.justification: EdgeBank is introduced as a new baseline method in the paper.
is_contributed.quote: Based on this observation, we propose a pure memorization-based baseline called EdgeBank.

is_executed.justification: The performance of EdgeBank is empirically evaluated against other models.
is_executed.quote: EdgeBank demonstrates competitive performance even when compared to SOTA methods.

is_compared.justification: EdgeBank is compared to other models to demonstrate its efficacy as a baseline.
is_compared.quote: In Fig. 1, we contrast the performance of SOTA methods with that of EdgeBank (in horizontal lines).

name.justification: UN Trade is a new dataset introduced to bring more domain diversity in dynamic link prediction evaluation.

name.justification: UN Vote, introduced in the paper, adds to the diversity of evaluation domains for dynamic graphs.

name.justification: The Contact dataset is a newly added dataset to the paper's contributions.
